paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.Glu74Gly, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: rapidly progressive neuropathy with small fiber involvement

individual_records.phenotype_details: severe polyneuropathy with small fiber involvement
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 35-year-old woman of Turkish origin presented to our outpatient clinic with severe polyneuropathy associated with distally pronounced tetraparesis and hypesthesia of 2 to 3 years’ duration.

individual_records.phenotype_details: tested positive for amyloid in a subcutaneous fat aspiration test
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Three of her four brothers and three sisters have since presented to our outpatient clinic. A 36-year-old brother tested positive for amyloid in a subcutaneous fat aspiration test.
Further family members in Turkey have been evaluated for the mutation. One cousin was found to be a mutation carrier; unfortunately, we have no further information on his health condition.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is associated with familial amyloid polyneuropathy, leading to severe neuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family, with one affected individual and three unaffected carriers.
variants.additional_notes: The patient presented with a unique phenotype compared to other reported cases with the same mutation.
key_quotes: In this case report, we emphasize that, in patients with progressive neuropathy with small fiber involvement, an amyloid neuropathy should be considered in the differential diagnosis.
To the best of our knowledge, this report is the first in the literature describing a patient who presented exclusively with severe neuropathy as a symptom of the rare p.Glu74Gly mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was extracted from the main text.
